summary: A "technology park" refers to a designated area that fosters innovation and collaboration among businesses, research institutions, and governmental entities, particularly within the European Union. These parks are integral to industrial structures and policy, promoting economic development through the incubation of high-tech enterprises. The EU supports technology parks as part of its broader strategy to enhance competitiveness and sustainability in the knowledge economy. By providing infrastructure, access to funding, and networking opportunities, technology parks facilitate the transfer of knowledge and technology, thereby contributing to regional development and the advancement of industrial policy objectives across member states.
